resources.string:
Special voor SIM hebben we een app gemaakt: Sensei City Runner 
Met de app kan je figuren in de stad lopen, die vervolgens worden weergegeven op de kaart. 
De City Runner app is niet alleen leuk, met je hardloop run genereer je Big Data en draagt bij aan wetenschappelijk onderzoek! 
Zo gaan de wetenschappers aan de Hogeschool van Amsterdam de geannonimeerde gegevens verder analyseren om nieuwe inzichten te ontwikkelen op het gebied van hardlopen in de stad.

Daarnaast kom je in delen van de stad waar je misschien nog nooit bent geweest. 

Of je hard of zacht loopt maakt niet uit, zolang het maar veilig en leuk is! 

Dus, trek je harloopschoenen aan en doe je zweetbandjes om!

Selecteer een track die dichtbij is 
Loop deze track uit 
en zie je figuur verschijnen! 
Deel je favoriete figuren om te laten zien dat jij de ultieme City Runner bent!

To make the app work perfect and for our research we need some data. \nDon\'t worry we don\'t need to know much and the data is processed anonymously. \nStill if you are not comfortable with filling in the data, leave it blank.
If you are a student from the HvA and are participating in the Student In Motions -week \nWe also need your team number.
Yes! Run finished! \nTake a look at your stats
This app is based on OsmAnd http://osmand.net \nThis app is licensed under the LGPL v3 license http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html \nA copy of the source code can be provide when requested.
Thank you for using the SIM SENSEI City Runner app and enjoy running!

The SIM SENSEI City Runner app allows you to run figures in the city of Amsterdam. 
The City Runner app is made by the Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences (Hogeschool van Amsterdam), and a result of the collaboration between the Students in Motion project, the COMMIT research project SENSEI, the Amsterdam Centre of Expertise project Sense in the City and the CitySDK project. 
 
The City Runner app is part of a scientific study designed to help researchers to analyse how you run and how you feel when running. 
The app logs movement and location data while you are running. Before and after a run it asks for your emotional state. 
Your data is saved under an anonymous account. 
 
More information about the app can be found at http://digitallifecentre.nl/projecten/sensei-sensor-based-engagement-for-improved-health?lang=en 
 
By using this application you concent to allowing your data to be used by researchers in order to better recognize and coach sporting activities.

The SIM SENSEI City Runner app allows you to run figures in the city of Amsterdam. 
The app is made for the Student in Motions week and part of a scientific study designed to help researchers to analyse how you run and how you feel when running. 
 
More information about Students in Motion can be found here 
More information about the research can be found here

To start running take the following steps: 
 
1. Select your neighbourhood 
2. Choose a route te run 
3. Give your current emotional state 
4. Run the route 
5. When finished, give your new emtional state 
6. You all done! Go run some more, or admire your run on the CitySDK
Please navigate to the starting point before starting your run. \n And press the start button to start running!
Move within 300m distance of your starting point to begin. \nYou are currently x meters from your starting point:
